message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.MM, cs.AI, cs.LG. 

The paper proposes a learning-based approach for reconstructing a 360 panorama from a sparse set of conventional images. This involves estimating the field of view of the input images and synthesizing a high-resolution panoramic output. Therefore, the paper is likely to belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) sub-category, which deals with image and video processing, analysis, and understanding. 

Additionally, the paper involves graphics (cs.GR) as it deals with the synthesis of panoramic images. Multimedia (cs.MM) is also a possible sub-category as the paper involves processing and synthesizing images. 

The paper also involves artificial intelligence (cs.AI) as it uses a learning-based approach for image synthesis. Finally, the paper involves machine learning (cs.LG) as it uses a learning-based approach for image synthesis.
